meanings.definition: Relating to or involving a notary
meanings.sent1: The notarial stamp on the document confirmed its authenticity.
meanings.sent2: The notarial services were required to legalize the contract.
meanings.sent3: The notarial seal was so official, it made the paper look important.
meanings.sent4: Her notarial expertise was like a shield against fraud.
meanings.sent5: The notarial process made the agreement legally binding.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the duties or functions of a notary
meanings.sent1: The notarial duties included verifying signatures.
meanings.sent2: She studied the notarial responsibilities before taking the exam.
meanings.sent3: The notarial tasks kept him busy all day.
meanings.sent4: His notarial role was crucial in the legal proceedings.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the notarial obligations was essential for the job.

meanings.definition: Involving or pertaining to the certification or authentication of documents by a notary
meanings.sent1: The notarial process ensured the document's validity.
meanings.sent2: They sought notarial approval for the contract.
meanings.sent3: The notarial verification gave the document a stamp of approval.
meanings.sent4: Her notarial certification was recognized nationwide.
meanings.sent5: The notarial authentication added a layer of security to the paperwork.
